OCD.name: CloudCat
OCD.description: Creates a pair of CloudClient instances and copies messages between them. In a typical scenario, the first client connects to the cloud platform broker via the default CloudService. The second client connects to the embedded broker via a second CloudService instance. An external process, connected to the embedded broker, can optionally subscribe to the topic namespace of the second client i.e. second-account-name/second-device-id/second.cloud.client.app.id/# to receive data messages and $EDC/second-account-name/second-device-id/second.cloud.client.app.id/# to receive control messages where the account name and devide ID are configured in the DataTransportService layer of the CloudClient's CloudService. Messages will be relayed between the first and second client preserving the application topic and the QoS of the incoming meessage: [$EDC/]first-account-name/first-device-id/first.cloud.client.app.id/app-topic <-> [$EDC/]second-account-name/second-device-id/second.cloud.client.app.id/app-topic.

AD.name: Relay Enable
AD.description: Enable relaying messages between CloudClient instances.

AD.name: First CloudService PID
AD.description: The PID of the CloudService used by the first CloudClient, e.g. org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService.

AD.name: Second CloudService PID
AD.description: The PID of the CloudService used by the first CloudClient, e.g. org.eclipse.kura.cloud.CloudService-2.

AD.name: First CloudClient App ID
AD.description: The application identifier of the first CloudClient.

AD.name: Second CloudClient App ID
AD.description: The application identifier of the second CloudClient.

AD.name: First CloudClient Control Subscriptions
AD.description: Comma-separated list of control subscriptions, each in the form control-app-topic;Qos. Usually not needed in virtue of the CloudService default subscription.

AD.name: Second CloudClient Control Subscriptions
AD.description: Comma-separated list of control subscriptions, each in the form control-app-topic;Qos. Usually not needed in virtue of the CloudService default subscription.

AD.name: First CloudClient Data Subscriptions
AD.description: Comma-separated list of data subscriptions, each in the form data-app-topic;Qos. Usually not needed.

AD.name: Second CloudClient Data Subscriptions
AD.description: Comma-separated list of data subscriptions, each in the form data-app-topic;Qos.
